title: Seiichi Morimura, who exposed Japanese atrocities in WWII, dies at 90
description: Mr. Morimura's book about Unit 731, a secret biological warfare branch of the Imperial Army, helped force Japan to confront its wartime past.

title: Military mutiny in Nigeria comes after string of coups across region
description: The coup attempt comes amid a backdrop of political upheaval across the region.

title: On southern front, Ukrainian forces aim to smash through Russian defenses
description: Ukrainian troops made slow but steady gains Thursday in their ongoing counteroffensive to drive a wedge through the Russian-occupied south.

title: African leaders urge Putin to end blockade of Ukraine’s grain
description: Putin's move has heightened fears that the blockade will lead to a spike in food prices, worsening a global food security emergency in the Horn of Africa.

title: 2,000-year-old grave probably belonged to a female warrior, study says
description: An Iron Age grave on an English island mystified archaeologists for years. New research shows it belonged to a young woman — who may have been a warrior leader.

title: In the Bahamas, a smuggler’s paradise thrives on today’s cargo: people
description: On unseaworthy or overloaded boats, migrants try to cross some 50 miles of treacherous waters from Bimini to Florida. For some, this is where the journey ends.

title: In photos: At least five dead as Typhoon Doksuri floods the Philippines
description: The typhoon, which displaced at least 26,000 people in the Philippines, is expected to hit southern China, including Guangzhou and Fujian, on Friday.

title: From salesman to ‘spy’: An inside account of arbitrary arrest in China
description: The tale of Taiwanese businessman Lee Meng-chu, detained in China four years ago, underscores the dangers of working in a China with shifting "red lines."

title: Deposed Niger president calls for democracy to be protected after coup
description: Niger President Mohamed Bazoum said democratic gains made in the West African country would be “protected," a day after he was ousted from power in a coup.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Kyiv gains some ground in south; Sweden accuses Kremlin of smear campaign
description: Sweden, which is set to join NATO soon, claimed Moscow is backing a disinformation campaign to discredit it in the eyes of Muslims.

title: With Wagner in Belarus, tension grows on northern Ukraine border
description: Fears have grown along Ukraine's northern border since Yevgeniy Prigozhin's Wagner Group mercenaries relocated to Belarus after their abortive mutiny in Russia.

title: African nations aren’t tilting toward Putin’s Russia
description: Russia's summit with African leaders faces the problem of a continent that doesn't want to align.

title: Soldiers in Niger claim president is ousted in coup
description: If successful, it would mark the latest in a string of coups in the region. But the status of President Mohamed Bazoum was not clear Wednesday night.
